page.title: 09A LOOK AT OVERY TOWN
page.content: Overy Town is the small inland, older portion of the Parish of Burnham Overy. It has a resident population of only 50 and is situated mainly along the A149 road from Burnham Market to Wells-next-the-Sea. On the River Burn, which forms the Western boundary, is one of two arable farms. Until 1950 the owners were also millers, grinding their own flour and feedstuffs and supplying the area. The water mill remains intact. The other farm is opposite the lovely old Church of St. Clement with it's centre tower, and together with eight of the cottages is owned by the Holkham Estates. Of the 42 properties (constructed mainly of brick, flint and chalk) only 26 are occupied, the others being holiday homes. Only 7 children of school age still live in this mainly agricultural community.
